Title:
Exophiala similis sp. nov., a novel black yeast from soil in
southern China
Abstract:
Exophiala is a ubiquitous pleomorphic genus, many of which
are associated with infections in human and animal, and some species
distribute plants and natural environments. In a survey of soil fungal
diversity in Yunnan, PR China, a novel taxon, Exophiala similis sp.
nov., was identified using combined morphology and phylogeny.
Morphologically, this species is characterized by having torulose,
septate hyphae, and swollen, terminal or intercalary conidiogenous cells
arising at acute angles from aerial hyphae. Phylogenetic analysis of the
combined sequences of the internal transcribed spacer, the small and
large nuclear ribosomal RNA subunit and the partial Î²-tubulin gene
confirmed its new species status within the genus Exophiala.
